intro: Iridorkis thisbe, commonly known as the moonlight orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its striking, bioluminescent petals that glow faintly under moonlight, a unique adaptation for attracting nocturnal pollinators. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a waxy coating that helps reduce water loss in its arid environment. Its flowers bloom only during the night, releasing a subtle fragrance that lures in moths and bats. Due to its limited habitat and delicate nature, Iridorkis thisbe is considered an endangered species.
